item.source: Incrementing Array to Set value for

item.title: Incrementing Array to Set value for
item.dc:creator: @N4TH4N N4TH4N
item.description:
@N4TH4N wrote:

[quote=“The Un-Named, post:6, topic:23997”]“for i := 1 to 10 do” is like repeat. It goes up 1 each time until i := 10. Run this in scar:

var
i : Integer;

begin
for i := 1 to 10 do
Writeln(IntToStr(i));
end.[/quote]
Oh I understand that, but if I set a max value for i and there is supposed to be more than that amount it kind of messes it up.

Read full topic
item.source: Incrementing Array to Set value for

item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

“for i := 1 to 10 do” is like repeat. It goes up 1 each time until i := 10. Run this in scar:

var
i : Integer;

begin
for i := 1 to 10 do
Writeln(IntToStr(i));
end.

item.title: Incrementing Array to Set value for
item.dc:creator: @N4TH4N N4TH4N
item.description:
@N4TH4N wrote:

make it so I can use a loop to change which array key I am setting a value to WHEN the number of keys is unknown. Normally you would have to put:
arr[0] := ‘blah’;
arr[1] := ‘blah’;
…

item.source: Incrementing Array to Set value for

item.title: Incrementing Array to Set value for
item.dc:creator: @N4TH4N N4TH4N
item.description:
@N4TH4N wrote:

How would I do something similar to:

[scar]var
i, a: Integer;
arr: Array of Integer;

begin
repeat
i := i + 1;
until(i = 3)
setarraylength(arr, i)
repeat
arr[a] := ‘blah’;
a := a + 1;
until(a = i);
end.[/scar]

I don’t know the exact amount of keys in an array so I need it to auto increment which array it is setting a value to.

Read full topic
item.source: Incrementing Array to Set value for
